definition: To successfully complete or pass a test, examination, or evaluation, demonstrating knowledge, skills, or competence in a particular subject or field. It is commonly used to describe the outcome of academic assessments or professional examinations.

examples.english: She insists on her point of view.

examples.german: Er besteht darauf, dass er recht hat.
examples.english: He insists that he is right.
The bridge is made of steel.

examples.german: Wir bestehen auf einer schnellen Lösung.
examples.english: We insist on a quick solution.
